email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Hope you're doing well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, available for this route. She’s a 150,000 DWT tanker with an LOA of 280 meters. The laycan is 15-20 October. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than we were hoping for. Could you consider something in the high 40s, say $49.50 per metric ton? Also, can you confirm the laytime and demurrage terms?

Best,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thanks for your feedback. I understand your position, but $49.50 is a bit tight given current market conditions. How about we meet in the middle at $50.25 per metric ton? Laytime is 72 hours total, and demurrage is set at $25,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for the revised offer. We can agree to $50.25 per metric ton, provided the laycan remains firm at 15-20 October. Please confirm the demurrage terms and send over the draft charter party for review.

Best,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Great, I’m glad we could reach an agreement. The laycan is confirmed for 15-20 October, and demurrage remains at $25,000 per day pro rata. I’ll have the draft charter party sent over to you by end of day today. Let me know if you need anything else in the meantime.

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sarah,

Sounds good. Looking forward to reviewing the charter party. Thanks for your help on this.

Best,
John
